properties.Title: Ram Head Cup
properties.Text: Levantine, 14th– 13th centuryBCE.  Faience, length: 11. 3 cm(4 7/ 16 in. )\.   diameter: 7. 4 cm(2 15/16 in. ).  From Tomb 86 atEnkomi (Cyprus).  The BritishMuseum, London, Excavated bythe Turner Bequest Excavations,1897,0401. 1212.

properties.Title: Pitcher in the Form of a Hippopotamus
properties.Description: Pitcher in the form of a hippopotamus
properties.Text: Nubian, c.  1700– 1550 BCE. Terracotta, height: 20. 5 cm (8 1 / 16 in. ).   length: 26.  5 cm (10 7/16 in. ).  From Tomb K 330 in the South Cemetery at Kerma, Nubia (Sudan).  Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Harvard University—Boston Museum of Fine Arts Expedition, 21. 11804.

properties.Title: Lion BIBRÛ
properties.Text: Anatolian, Old Assyrian Trading Colony Period, early 2nd millennium BCE. Painted terracotta, height: 20. 5 cm (8 1/16 in. ).   length: 21. 5 cm (8 7/16 in. ).  From Kültepe, ancient Kanesh (Turkey).  Musée du Louvre, Paris, AM 1517.

properties.Title: Bull Head Rhyton
properties.Text: Post-Palatial (LateMinoan IIIA:2), 14th– 13th centuryBCE.  Painted terracotta, height: 18. 8 cm (6 5/8 in. ).   length: 16. 4 cm (6 7/16 in. ).  From Karpathos (Greece).  The British Museum, London, Donated by W.  R.  Paton, 1887,0501. 6 (A871).

properties.Title: Ram Head Rhyton
properties.Text: Mycenaean (LateHelladic A:2), 14th– 13th centuryBCE.  Painted terracotta,height: 21. 5 cm (8 7/16 in. ).   diameter: 16 cm (6 5/16 in. ).  From Ras Shamra-Ugarit - Minet el-Beida(Syria).  Musée du Louvre, Paris, AO 19932.

properties.Title: Bull Rhyton
properties.Text: Cypriot, 14th– 13th century BCE. Painted terracotta, Base Ringware, height:  20. 3 cm (8 in. ).  length: 24 cm (9 7/16 in. ).  FromTomb 15 at Maroni (Cyprus). The British Museum, London, Excavated by the British Museum,1898,1201. 142 (A45).

properties.Title: Uruk (Warka) vase
properties.Text: Sumerian (Late Uruk), end of 4th millennium BCE.  Alabaster.  From Uruk (Iraq).  Iraq Museum, Baghdad, IM 19606.
